definition: A building that serves as the headquarters or official residence for the governing body of a region or country, typically housing various government offices and departments. It is commonly used to refer to the physical structure where political decisions are made and administrative tasks are carried out.

examples.german: Das Regierungsgebäude steht im Zentrum der Stadt.
examples.english: The government building is located in the center of the city.

examples.german: Das Regierungsgebäude wurde im neoklassizistischen Stil erbaut.
examples.english: The government building was built in the neoclassical style.
The government building houses various ministries.

examples.german: Das Regierungsgebäude ist ein architektonisches Wahrzeichen der Stadt.
examples.english: The government building is an architectural landmark of the city.

examples.german: Das Regierungsgebäude wurde während des Zweiten Weltkriegs schwer beschädigt.
examples.english: The government building was heavily damaged during World War II.
